abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Industrial Credit Project for
            Ireland substantially met its two primary objectives of (i)
            supporting Ireland's efforts to reduce regional
            imbalance in industrial development; and (ii) supporting the
            expansion of small-scale industrial projects. Some of the
            quantitative targets of the loan, such as percentages of
            allocations to regional development outside Dublin and of
            loan funds to small-scale industrial projects, were not
            fully achieved. However, flexibility on the part of the
            Borrower and the Bank was justified in light of economic
            developments. High unemployment in Dublin County caused the
            development of industry there to continue to be a major
            policy goal, which in turn forced the Government to change
            its priorities in 1977. The groundwork undertaken during
            this project supported the Borrower's financing of
            small-scale enterprises and succeeded in meeting its
            objective of employment generation. The Borrower's
            financial performance was satisfactory and arrears are not a
            major problem. This project was one of the last Bank
            operations in Ireland. Along with the First Industrial
            Credit Project, this project contributed to active and
            worthwhile relationships between the Irish Government, the
            Industrial Credit Company, Ltd. (ICC), and the Bank. The ICC
            has developed into a mature and efficient institution thanks
            in part to the Bank projects.

abstracts.cdata!:
The loan will support a strengthening in
            ICC's involvement in the promotion of regional
            development and employment. It will assist in the provision
            of credit for the financing of specific devvelopment
            projects in the industrial and distributive sectors (except
            retail outlets), in support of the country's policies
            to reduce regional imbalances and unemployment through
            industrial development. ICC hopes to use the proceeds of the
            loan to finance projects outside Dublin County and 40
            percent of the loan to finance small-scale development enterprises.
